title: FC Rostov boss plays down pitch fears ahead of Manchester United clash - 'it is the same for both teams'
text:
Marcos Rojo during training (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Rostov coach Ivan Daniliants has told Jose Mourinho his fears over the state of their pitch are unfounded. 
Mourinho wants Manchester United's Europa League last 16 tie at the Olimp-2 Stadium called off because of the treacherous nature of the pitch. 
But Daniliants, while admitting his club would like to provide a better playing surface, said the pitch was far worse for last month's tie against Sparta Prague. 
And the Rostov coach dismissed Mourinho's fears his players are more at risk from injury playing on the uneven, patchwork surface. 
“It will be the same pitch for Rostov and Manchester United but we understand our rivals are not used to playing on this kind of pitch with these conditions," said Daniliants. The pitch is in a poor condition (Photo: REUTERS) General view of the stadium before training (Photo: REUTERS) Mourinho and the United players (Photo: REUTERS) 
"But it's the same reality for both of us. There were no incidents on this pitch before because we already played Sparta Prague and the condition of it was worse. 
“Even our players can be injured but football is a contact sport. United's players during training (Photo: REUTERS) Rostov boss Ivan Daniliants (Photo: Getty) 
"Players can be injured playing on the best pitches in the best weather in the best conditions. 
“But we understand it's not a decision of our club but a decision of UEFA whether we play the match or not, but to be sure we would like to play on a better pitch than this." poll loading Will Manchester United defeat Rostov and progress to the quarter-finals? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
